message: hit a bit of a puzzle today - had a branch that had a merge from upstream
I wanted to use rebase -i to drop one of my commits from the history
I aborted and worked around by checking out the file in question from master, then cherry-picking my earlier changes back on top, then doing a straight merge
it failed saying that it couldn't apply one of the merged commits
are there known complications rebasing after a merge from upstream?
Devil's advocate: why not revert that commit? The history might not be pristine but it'd be cleaner once you have more than one repo
